title: (x) "David Shrigley stages Real Time Society" grotesk - Reymond Grotesk {Zachary}
author: Biff

comments.content:
[Maple](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152514/http:/processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/index.html) (thanks to Indie Fonts 3).

EDIT: Wait a sec, that's not right (although it's reminiscent). And it's not [DynaGrotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152514/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-55-dynagrotesk) either. I know I've seen it recently, though....

Nah, there are major differences in the a, g, s, S, etc.

[http://processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/characterset.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152514/http:/processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/characterset.html "http://processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/maple/characterset.html")

That wound be Reymond Grotesk by Aur√®le Sack. I could not find it online, but it's in the [Ecal Graphic Design](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152514/http:/www.ecal.ch/publications/publications.htm?ps=ps7&active=&title=ecal%20%3a%20publications&news_id=42) book. I'm posting, a photo, but I'm sorry if it's not totally clear.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152514im_/http:/typophile.com/files/ReymondGrotesk_3534.jpg)
Ah, I have that book. Knew it looked familiar. I'm always after fonts that I can't get. Thanks.

You might also like [Parry Grotrsque](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152514/http:/www.ourtype.be/) and Kris Sowersby's upcoming [National Grotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152514/http:/klim.co.nz/national_samples.php).

This font is gonna be released, someday soon.  
 [http://a4.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash2/74072\_465914497047\_835662...](http://web.archive.org/web/20110220152514/http:/a4.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash2/74072_465914497047_835662047_5506199_7144106_n.jpg "http://a4.sphotos.ak.fbcdn.net/hphotos-ak-ash2/74072\_465914497047\_835662047\_5506199\_7144106\_n.jpg")
